r10281 | burschik | 2012-11-11 06:16:51 -0600 (Sun, 11 Nov 2012) | 6 lines

Restore the factory-level bonus of arsenal. This fixes bug #3559996:
arsenal gives wrong number of muskets, but restores the situation
reported as bug #3430371: Arsenal should not give free muskets in
"Classic". Regardless of what the original game did, it simply makes
no sense to build an arsenal unless it grants an additional bonus.

r9974 | mpope | 2012-07-04 05:05:05 -0600 (Wed, 04 Jul 2012) | 1 line

Prevent animation failure.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9972 | mpope | 2012-07-03 16:37:12 -0600 (Tue, 03 Jul 2012) | 28 lines

Quantify the connected tile attribute.

Improve the `connected to Europe' attribute by converting it to an integer
(with adequate backward compatibility) containing the number of tiles to
a tile directly connected to the high seas.  This allows the colony site
evaluator to score coastal sites *without* having to call the expensive
path finding code at every tile.

In passing, renamed related functions that were slightly misleading:
Tile.isCoast -> isShore
Tile.isConnected -> isHighSeasConnected
Tile.canMoveToEurope -> canMoveToHighSeas
TileType.isConnected -> isHighSeasConnected
Settlement.isConnected -> isConnectedPort
Unit.canMoveToEurope -> canMoveToHighSeas
added TileType.isDirectlyHighSeasConnected
added Tile.get/setHighSeasCount
removed unnecessary Colony.isConnected

...but not Player.canMoveToEurope, as that directly tests for the
presence of Europe, whereas the above all look at map properties.

Removed special case of map edge water tiles allowing a direct move to
Europe.  However the highSeasCount calculation still applies an
explicit positive "moveToEurope" attribute override to non-highSeas
tiles with the "connected" type attribute that are on the vertical
edges.  This keeps the test suite maps working, but should not affect
any of the standard maps.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r9783 | mpope | 2012-04-27 19:26:46 -0600 (Fri, 27 Apr 2012) | 7 lines

Put distinct minimumColonySize modifier onto each stockade-type, BR#3522055.

The colonyPanel.minimumColonySize message uses the modifier source to
describe the building that is preventing the size reduction.  The
modifier was only on model.building.stockade, which while correctly
inherited by model.building.fort, then when trying to reduce the
population of a fort, the message complains about a stockade.

r9383 | mpope | 2011-12-20 03:21:11 -0600 (Tue, 20 Dec 2011) | 12 lines

Another bug fix and cleanup of path finding.

- Found and fixed a nasty problem with path finding where direct but slower
  (in turns) paths would be preferred over slightly longer but faster ones
  that used a carrier.
- We have Unit.findPath.  Make sure we use it wherever possible, and
  Unit.findPathToEurope, and add Unit.search.  Almost all code now
  uses these, which are cleaner and clearer.
- Drop the multiple versions of Map.{findPath,search}, except for the
  special unit-less forms which should still be called directly, underlining
  that they are special.
- Code cleanups (indenting, documentation).
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Several revisions to AIColony handling.

- Improved starvation mitigation.
- Improved defender choice.
- Rolled defence heuristic back into isBadlyDefended().
- Dropped checkConditionsForHorseBreed as we no longer mount units if it
  would drop the horse count below the breeding number.
- Fixed several bugs.
- Extensive logging available (FINEST) of *why* units are chosen for
  their jobs.

Similarly, wagons are not persons either.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9275 | mpope | 2011-12-06 05:29:43 -0600 (Tue, 06 Dec 2011) | 9 lines

Prevent ships being classed as persons.

This is a bit curly because isPerson is allowing the foundColony
ability to signify a person for backward compatibility reasons.
We will lose this in due course (and just rely on model.ability.person)
but ATM ships are picking up the Player-level foundColony (which is true
for Europeans), so they need to be explicitly told they are not able
to found colonies --- Unit.hasAbility sorts this out, but it is a bit
non-obvious, hence this long comment.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9087 | mpope | 2011-10-11 02:59:37 -0600 (Tue, 11 Oct 2011) | 11 lines

Unify form of child element serialization.

Try to keep things simple--- the single argument form of writeChildren
works everywhere except where there are `hidden' children, such as the
units working inside a settlement, where you need the multi-argument
form.  Do not mix them!  Any class that has hidden children, or
classes that implement hidden children should always use the
multi-argument form.  Anywhere this degrades to the single argument
form the behaviour becomes either too generous (players can see each
other's hidden children) or too restrictive (players can not see their
own hidden children).
------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r9072 | mpope | 2011-10-08 00:17:44 -0600 (Sat, 08 Oct 2011) | 9 lines

Split Colony.getWorkLocations into three specific forms.

- getCurrentWorkLocations: gets the work locations currently owned by the
      colony.  This is usually the one to use for colony status operations.
- getFreeWorkLocations:    gets the work locations currently owned by the
      colony, plus those that can be freely claimed.  This is useful when
      considering a potential expansion of the colony.
- getAllWorkLocations:  gets all work locations, regardless of ownership.
      Only used in serialization ATM.
------------------------------------------------------------------------

r7160 | nickshanks | 2010-07-10 11:00:38 -0600 (Sat, 10 Jul 2010) | 8 lines

improvements to the Modern colony labels:
* do not display the production bonus if it is zero
* do not display the production bonus for foreign colonies (it was wrong anyway, always showing zero)
* move the native tribe's capital settlement indicator down from a tile chip to the label
* realign where the label is placed, vertically, to be centered on the bottom pixel of the tile diamond (the hutzli mod was causing problems)
* increase the horizontal padding both around the text and between the three bubbles
* make the minimum bubble width at least as great as the height, so that the left and right boxes look square most of the time

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r6363 | burschik | 2010-01-24 10:29:54 -0600 (Sun, 24 Jan 2010) | 8 lines

Extend radius of settlements.

Most Indian settlements have a radius of one tile, capitals have a
radius of two tiles. Aztec and Inca settlements have a radius of two
tiles, and their capitals have a radius of three tiles. The radius of
settlements and capitals are now fields of the NationType class, and
attributes of the IndianNationType in the specification.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

When conquering an enemy colony, plunder gold proportional to (colony size)/(sum of all colony sizes).

Especially, this means taking the last colony will take ALL gold from a player, potentially leading to an earlier defeat!

Plundering settlements still takes 10% of current gold.

r4766 | abartels | 2008-12-27 14:28:10 -0600 (Sat, 27 Dec 2008) | 10 lines

Changes some resource boni for Col1-compatibility. Specifically:

Minerals: No silver modifier
Tundra: No Minerals bonus resource
Water tile types: Base production of fish is 4, not 2
River: Add +2 to Fur and Lumber production, not +1
Road: dto.
Expert Farmer: Food production modifer is +3, not +2
Expert Fisherman: dto. for Fish

r2272 | coezbek | 2007-05-15 05:17:22 -0600 (Tue, 15 May 2007) | 8 lines

Added Location.getColony() to get the Colony this Location is associated with or null if not in a Colony().

Refactored all occurances of Unit.getTile().getColony() to use this new Method.

This change was necessary to fix the problems of teachers leaving a colony, joining another one and still retain their teaching progress. This issue is fixed and tested in this commit.

The patch was written by Eric Boumaour.
